1.1: I met a traveller from an antique land, Who said—“Two vast and trunkless legs of stone Stand in the desert. . . . Near them, on
1.2: the sand, Half sunk a shattered visage lies, whose frown, And wrinkled lip, and sneer of cold command, Tell that its sculptor we
1.3: ll those passions read Which yet survive, stamped on these lifeless things, The hand that mocked them, and the heart that fed; A

2.1: nd on the pedestal, these words appear: My name is Ozymandias, King of Kings; Look on my Works, ye Mighty, and despair!" Nothing
2.2: beside remains. Round the decay Of that colossal Wreck, boundless and bare The lone and level sands stretch far away.
